title: When are you getting rid of blind pick?
body:
Why is it even there?

Just give us draft normal, then you don't have to rely on your internet and quick typing skills and the good grace of chatblock to get the role you want

replies.body: I honestly don't see why it wasn't removed once team builder became a thing. I would use team-builder all the time if the que times weren't so horrifically long.

imo

there should be only teambuilder and draft pick
no blind pick


the only good thing about blind is that is quick and mainly for casual players

Teambuilder would be as quick as Blind Pick if Blind Pick didn't exist. 

The only reason why Teambuilder isn't played is because the queues are long. The queues are long because no one plays it. 

I think they should just delete Blind Pick.

2 weeks later

"Due to the lack of harrasment reports we have been seeing we are now removing the report feature at the end of game screen, you may instead lodge a support ticket with the data from your game and be assured that someone WILL actually spend time to review it and not hate their job."

4 months later, an online article reads "Valve is now taking notes from Riot game's popular league of legends as they are now the only online gaming company to completely turn around their community to become one of the most healthy and supportive gaming communities in the world. I'd rather wait for the draft to finish then get a lane i barely know how to play cause i main a lane i didn't get so get rid of blind pick and make it all draft will make the champ select better especially when someone doesn't get their lane they just either instalock or whinge about it the whole game.{{summoner:3}}

The queue times are longer because simply people do prefer blind pick over team-builder when it is enabled. I for one would really like to have draft pick back myself however blind pick is a pretty important part of league's player base. As much as I would like to have all game modes enabled I don't want to be trading game modes for other ones. #ForShurima
